chapter.name: MaxScore Editor: Preferences
chapter.p: To open the Preferences, go to “View” menu on the upper left-hand side of the window and choose “Preferences”, or use the shortcut Shift-3. In the Preferences window, you can set the canvas size as well as change the title and subtitle of your project and add the name of the composer. You can choose to show this information on the score by clicking on the Show Title toggle. You also have the possibility customize the positioning of the entire score. Use the “Title Margin”, “Left Margin”, “Right Margin”, etc. options. You can also choose to show or hide markings such as tempo, time signatures, key signatures etc. by setting the corresponding toggles. In addition, you can also customize your score by changing the color of the background or using another text or music font. Hit the “Save Preferences” button on the bottom of the page, if you want to make your changes the new default.
This is a comprehensive list of the current options:

ul.li: First System Indent - indentation for the first system
Set Wrap - on/off: 1 system per page
Set Measure Number Offset - enter a value for the measure number on the first measure in the score.
Set Hold Scaler - change the default for the hold time parameter
Set Durational Spacing Base - change the vertical spacing between notes. The higher the number the more equally the notes will be spaced.
Music Font - we currently support the Bravura and Petaluma fonts

chapter.p: Set the path to your personal Picster Library

ul.li: Quantization - from the first drop-down menu select a main duration (whole Note (W), half Note (H) or Quarter Note(Q)). From the number box dropping menu select the subdivision to which to quantize. Add modes, set the default or clear your setting with buttons to the right

chapter.p: Select a Time Unit (pixels/second) for scrolling. By default is "100"; the lowest possible value is "5".

p.i: You can also save your preferences as a preset file by clicking “Save Preference as…” button. If this option is chosen, you can use them next time you create a new score by going to Preferences (shift-3) and selecting the preferred one by clicking on “Open Preferences”

chapter.p: By clicking on Attribute List you can inspect the MaxScore attributes being saved as preferences.
